metadata.titel_preek: Epiphany: The Fear of the Lord and the New Thing

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God irrupts into the mundane and sinful lives of humans to judge their resistance and bestow a new, unmerited identity/vocation.

tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
He puts redemption into our blanket
The God who terrifies is also the one who loves us

object.identificatie: Redemption, New Life, and the 'Enabling Word'
tekstueel_bewijs: the firm ground of their salvation

zender.identificatie: The Holy One of Israel / Yahweh
tekstueel_bewijs: the source of all good things... as mercy from above

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Sinful Humanity (Gideon, Peter, the Exile, the Addict)
tekstueel_bewijs: You and I are deep in sin
the young woman who lives in the Port Authority

helper.identificatie: The Angel of the Lord / The Holy Spirit / The Prophet
tekstueel_bewijs: the angel of the Lord is equivalent to the Lord himself
the prophet opens his ministry by addressing the people

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as an ontological state ('deep in sin') and a power that would lead to being 'lost' if not for divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to 'turn oneself around' or hide from judgment.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human (The Addict/Gideon)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human effort) is shown to be 'forlorn' or 'mundane' until the primary program (God's action) interrupts it.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God draws near to them both.
Jesus stoops down to us in our miserable condition.
The God who terrifies is also the one who loves us.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We clutch our privileges to ourselves.
We are trying to turn ourselves around.

voorbeelden: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.
We can understand and even admire the hope... for something better.
The awareness of sin comes only to those who are already standing on the firm ground.
God... has power to make our resistance go up in flames.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to act where humans are incompetent. Grace is an 'irruption' that grants a new state of being.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From Mundane (~S2) to Terror (S2) to Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between S1 and S2 is resolved in Christ, who takes the fire of judgment to give the word of peace.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; fear is described as 'plain terror' and 'holy dread'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject who initiates salvation regardless of human merit or 'turning around'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We can understand and even admire the hope... for something better.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He does not ask us what we are doing to make ourselves better; he just gives the gift.
God will interrupt the normal progression of things by arriving in—indeed, invading—the midst of human events.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon and Peter are used as types of the 'Receiver' of grace, not as moral examples to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God chooses the weak and the sinful.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; moving from self-reliance to reliance on the 'irruption' of God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is an act of God upon the passive/sinful human.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from OT fear to NT grace is handled through the lens of Christology.
spanning_punten: The tension between God being 'opposed to us' and 'for us' is the central pivot.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: paying in his own body the price of sin

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the 'Word' and 'Christ' than the specific person of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is an 'addiction' and 'rebelliousness' that leads to being 'lost'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the 'if-then' trap of moralism.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a strong grace-oriented stance.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Perhaps slightly more on the 'Devoir' of the response (ethics) as a secondary program.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology correctly precedes and enables Ethics.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon powerfully demonstrates the 'Grammar of Grace' by keeping God as the primary actor in the narrative of salvation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the imagery of the 'Port Authority', semiotics reveals that the woman is a 'Receiver' actant, proving the sermon's non-moralistic core.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Midianites; semiotics focuses on the 'Subject-Object' relationship between God and Gideon.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model reveals that even when the preacher mentions 'trying to turn around,' the narrative engine rejects this as the cause of the 'Object' (Redemption).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'The Fear of the Lord' not as a law-mandate but as a semiotic marker of the presence of the Divine Subject.
